bug.author: geweixuan
bug.summary: Building Alluxio from source, cannot open alluxio web with 19999 port
bug.description:
Alluxio Version: What version of Alluxio are you using? Describe the bug A clear and concise description of what the bug is. To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior (as minimally and precisely as possible) Expected behavior A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. Urgency Describe the impact and urgency of the bug.
Add any other context about the problem here. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36925694/57278414-f5c3af80-70d8-11e9-9523-9bc01e6a0c2c.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/geweixuan>@geweixuan</denchmark-link> ! We'll need some more information to debug your issue. Everything works fine on my end.
What command did you use to build alluxio? Which branch are you building from? and also, if possible, what is the date you attempted to build? Are there any useful messages in logs/master.log?

2019-05-08 10:58:11,885 WARN WebAppContext - Failed startup of context o.e.j.w.WebAppContext@7c6908d7{/,null,null}{/opt/FileServer/alluxio-1.8.1/core/server/common/src/main/webapp} java.io.FileNotFoundException: /opt/FileServer/alluxio-1.8.1/core/server/common/src/main/webapp at org.eclipse.jetty.webapp.WebInfConfiguration.unpack(WebInfConfiguration.java:493) at org.eclipse.jetty.webapp.WebInfConfiguration.preConfigure(WebInfConfiguration.java:72) at org.eclipse.jetty.webapp.WebAppContext.preConfigure(WebAppContext.java:468) at org.eclipse.jetty.webapp.WebAppContext.doStart(WebAppContext.java:504) at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.AbstractLifeCycle.start(AbstractLifeCycle.java:68) at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.ContainerLifeCycle.start(ContainerLifeCycle.java:132) at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.ContainerLifeCycle.doStart(ContainerLifeCycle.java:114) at org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler.doStart(AbstractHandler.java:61) at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.AbstractLifeCycle.start(AbstractLifeCycle.java:68) at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.ContainerLifeCycle.start(ContainerLifeCycle.java:132) at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.ContainerLifeCycle.doStart(ContainerLifeCycle.java:114) at org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler.doStart(AbstractHandler.java:61) at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.AbstractLifeCycle.start(AbstractLifeCycle.java:68) at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.ContainerLifeCycle.start(ContainerLifeCycle.java:132) at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.ContainerLifeCycle.doStart(ContainerLifeCycle.java:114) at org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler.doStart(AbstractHandler.java:61) at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.AbstractLifeCycle.start(AbstractLifeCycle.java:68) at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.ContainerLifeCycle.start(ContainerLifeCycle.java:132) at org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server.start(Server.java:387) at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.ContainerLifeCycle.doStart(ContainerLifeCycle.java:114) at org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler.doStart(AbstractHandler.java:61) at org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server.doStart(Server.java:354) at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.AbstractLifeCycle.start(AbstractLifeCycle.java:68) at alluxio.web.WebServer.start(WebServer.java:184) at alluxio.master.AlluxioMasterProcess.startServingWebServer(AlluxioMasterProcess.java:336) at alluxio.master.AlluxioMasterProcess.startServing(AlluxioMasterProcess.java:308) at alluxio.master.AlluxioMasterProcess.startServing(AlluxioMasterProcess.java:296) at alluxio.master.AlluxioMasterProcess.start(AlluxioMasterProcess.java:229) at alluxio.ProcessUtils.run(ProcessUtils.java:32) at alluxio.master.AlluxioMaster.main(AlluxioMaster.java:55)

It looks like your installation of Alluxio doesn't include the necessary files at /opt/FileServer/alluxio-1.8.1/core/server/common/src/main/webapp. What process did you follow to build and install Alluxio? If you follow the steps here to build (<denchmark-link:https://docs.alluxio.io/os/user/stable/en/contributor/Building-Alluxio-From-Source.html>https://docs.alluxio.io/os/user/stable/en/contributor/Building-Alluxio-From-Source.html</denchmark-link> ) and run then your web UI should appear. Otherwise, if you need a tarball that can be installed elsewhere, you can run <denchmark-code>./dev/scripts/generate-tarballs single </denchmark-code>
which should generate a tarball you can put install under /opt

How to include the necessary files at /opt/FileServer/alluxio-1.8.1/core/server/common/src/main/webapp. I'm follow the steps of (<denchmark-link:https://docs.alluxio.io/os/user/stable/en/contributor/Building-Alluxio-From-Source.html>https://docs.alluxio.io/os/user/stable/en/contributor/Building-Alluxio-From-Source.html</denchmark-link> ) alluxio version 1.8.1, doesn't have web UI

The following commands will check out v1.8.1 build, and then start it from the repository. They are all found in the document you linked git clone https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio.git cd alluxio git checkout v1.8.1 mvn -T 2C clean install -DskipTests -Dmaven.javadoc.skip -Dfindbugs.skip -Dcheckstyle.skip -Dlicense.skip ./bin/alluxio-start-.sh local SudoMount
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/geweixuan>@geweixuan</denchmark-link> Closing this due to inactivity, please reopen if you still have this issue.
